conclusion: Predict where liquid from points A, B, C, and D will flow after passing through baffles, reaching either container E or F.
The image shows a board with several colored baffle strips positioned at various angles.
Liquids will be released from points A, B, C, and D at the top.
The liquids need to flow down through the baffles.
There are two collection containers at the bottom: E and F.
Liquid starts at point A (from the green marker at top).
Liquid from point A first encounters a green diagonal baffle sloping downward from left to right.
Following the green diagonal baffle, liquid from A will move diagonally right.
After the green diagonal baffle, liquid from A continues downward.
Liquid from A eventually reaches the left side of the bottom area.
Liquid from A will flow into container E.
Liquid starts at point B (from the yellow marker at top).
Liquid from point B encounters the long turquoise/mint baffle sloping downward from right to left.
The turquoise/mint baffle directs liquid from B diagonally left and down.
Liquid from B continues falling straight until it reaches the bottom.
Liquid from B will flow into container F.
Liquid starts at point C (from the blue marker at top).
Liquid from C falls straight down until it meets a baffle.
Liquid from C would encounter the gray horizontal baffle.
The gray horizontal baffle directs liquid from C to the right side.
Liquid from C would flow into container F.
Liquid starts at point D (from the mint/light green marker at top).
Liquid from D falls straight down.
Liquid from D likely doesn't hit any baffle on its way down.
